#BitcoinDominance #BTCDOM #BTCDOMUSDT

The first drop started 22-June 2025. This is the main move and the start of the downtrend for the Bitcoin Dominance index.

The main low happened 24-August 2025. This is to say, that the market as a whole, Bitcoin and the altcoins, were in bullish territory until August, at that point the market entered a full blown bearish bias. As the market moved down, Bitcoin and the altcoins, the Bitcoin Dominance index (BTCDOMUSDT) started to move up.

BTCDOMUSDT has been rising since 24-August 2025. It peaked 10-October 2025 and then started to produce lower highs signaling that the bullish bias was losing strength.

Bitcoin Dominance stopped growing completely in early November, the 4th, and started to move sideways. It failed to break resistance over and over. The resistance zone is clearly depicted on this chart.

Now, after 194 days, we have the start of a new bearish wave. So the first wave-down was in June 2025 and the next one starts now, January 2026. This means that the altcoins market is about to produce a huge bullish cycle, Bitcoin will also grow. As Bitcoin Dominance goes down, everything Crypto grows.

If you like the SHORT side of a trade, here you have a set of trade-numbers for this trading pair. It is from mid-December 2025 but the numbers are still good today.

Thank you for reading, your continued support is highly appreciated. Happy New Year!

Namaste.

The realized market cap of newly emerged whales has been rising sharply.

While price remains near the highs,
large holders that entered recently are accumulating BTC at a scale rarely seen before.

Separate from short-term price fluctuations,
a rotation of players is taking place beneath the surface.

The market is quietly transitioning toward its next phase.

Bitcoin has broken above $90,500.

One key level cleared.
Now the question is whether this level can be held.

Looking at BTC perpetual futures funding rates,
they remain positive overall, but sharp local drops are appearing more frequently.
This suggests an environment where long positions tend to accumulate,
yet once positioning becomes crowded, rapid pullbacks driven by liquidations still occur.
Rather than focusing only on price,
this is a phase where it matters more to read the buildup of leverage
and the timing of its unwind.

Global liquidity has once again reached a new all-time high on a weekly basis.

Financial conditions are clearly no longer in a tightening phase,
but are tilting toward easing.

Liquidity at this level provides a meaningful tailwind
for equities, Bitcoin, and crypto assets.

Even if prices remain stagnant for a time,
the underlying liquidity backdrop is already signaling the next phase.

According to Julio Moreno (@jjcmoreno):

The idea that ‚Äúwhales are aggressively buying‚Äù is not accurate.
Much of the recent whale-related data is distorted by exchanges consolidating their BTC holdings into a smaller number of large addresses.

As a result,
it only appears as if whales are accumulating.

When exchange addresses are excluded,
actual whale balances are trending lower (Chart 1).

Likewise,
addresses in the 100‚Äì1,000 BTC range‚Äîoften assumed to include ETF-related holdings‚Äîare also declining (Chart 2).

What truly matters is not the visible increase or decrease in addresses,
but whose holdings are actually increasing.

U.S. crypto ETFs recorded net inflows of $32 billion in 2025.

Even during the market correction toward year-end, inflows remained resilient.

Breaking it down,
Bitcoin ETFs led the move with $21.4 billion in net inflows.

Separate from short-term price action,
medium- to long-term capital continues to accumulate steadily.

Bitcoin mining consumes more electricity than some entire countries.

That energy secures the network, but builds nothing beyond it.

The puzzles miners solve exist only to prove work was done. Once solved, the computation is discarded.

What if that didn‚Äôt have to be the case? üëá
Proof of Work itself isn‚Äôt the problem.

It‚Äôs actually elegant: security enforced by real-world cost.

Electricity, hardware, and capital make attacks expensive.

But, the long-accepted tradeoff has always been waste.

That assumption went unchallenged for years. Until now.
Qubic keeps the security model, and removes the waste.

On Qubic, mining doesn‚Äôt solve meaningless puzzles.

It trains artificial neural networks.

The same computation that secures the network also produces real, usable output: intelligence.

No extra energy. No parallel systems. One process.
üí≠ Food for thought:

If two networks offer equivalent security‚Ä¶
but one turns energy into intelligence
and the other turns energy into nothing‚Ä¶

Which architecture thrives long term?

Tomorrow: we'll explore how this actually works.

A potential scenario that could happen with Bitcoin in 2026 and what might be expected in 2027 and the following years $BTC    A price pattern created on a larger chart ten or even fifteen years ago shows strong similarities with Bitcoin's pattern.  ¬∑ Both major declines ("crashes") lasted approximately the same duration. ¬∑ The first decline was stronger than the second ‚Äì the correction waves were weak, and the bear had predominant strength. ¬∑ The second decline saw much more struggle between the bear and the bull, where it was clearer to see waves 2 and 4 showing stronger force from the bull's side.  The average upward wave also shows similarity: a pre-rise (marked with a pink arc) is visible, followed by five waves upward. The Bitcoin Genesis block was mined on January 3, 2009, at 18:15:05 UTC. In the UK, where creator Satoshi Nakamoto is believed to have lived, this was early evening.
The Hidden Message
Satoshi embedded a famous headline into the block's coinbase parameter: "The Times 03/Jan/2009 Chancellor on brink of second bailout for banks." This acted as a "proof of date" and a critique of the traditional financial system. Technically, this was hidden by converting the text into hexadecimal code (54 68 65 20 54 69 6d 65 73...), which is invisible to the software but readable by humans using block explorers.
The Unspendable 50 BTC
The original 50 BTC reward can never be spent. This is because the Genesis block was hardcoded into the software, but the code skips adding its transaction to the UTXO set (the database of valid, spendable coins). Any attempt to move them would be rejected by the network. This remains one of Bitcoin's greatest technical quirks‚Äîwhether intentional or a minor bug.
The 21 Million Cap
The total supply of Bitcoin will never actually reach 21 million. Due to the math of the halving cycle (the reward cutting in half every 210,000 blocks), the maximum possible supply is 20,999,999.9769 BTC.
The supply is even lower in practice because:
 * The Genesis 50: Those first coins are excluded from the spendable supply.
 * Rounding: The reward eventually hits the 8th decimal place and rounds down to zero.
 * Human Error: Early miners occasionally claimed lower rewards than permitted or lost access to their keys.
The final satoshi is projected to be mined around the year 2140, after which miners will rely entirely on transaction fees.

üö®üö®What Is CME Gap? 

Will All The Gaps Be Filled?
The Crypto market runs 24/7 without sleep, but Traditional Finance keeps office hours. This mismatch between the CME and the Spot market creates a fascinating phenomenon called the CME Gap. This is one of the most reliable indicators of money flow direction.

For Example.....
üî∏ The CME closes on Friday afternoon and reopens on Monday morning.
CME closes Friday with Bitcoin at $60,000. Over the weekend, good news breaks, and Bitcoin pumps to $62,000.
When CME reopens on Monday, the open price is $62,000. A price gap from $60,000 to $62,000 appears on the chart.

üî∏ Historical statistics show that about 90 to 95% of CME Gaps eventually get Filled. This means the price will reverse back to the $60,000 zone to close that void before resuming the main trend.

It is driven by Arbitrage Bots and Institutional Market Makers working to balance books and liquidity between Futures and Spot markets. The Gap acts as a magnet pulling the price back.
üîπ If early in the week you see Bitcoin pumping hard, creating a large CME Gap below, do not FOMO. It is highly likely a Fake Pump.
Patiently place Limit Buy orders right at the old Gap zone. Institutional money tends to come back to pick up the most patient passengers at this station.

On January 3, 2009 at 18:15:05 UTC, Satoshi mined the Genesis Block. This is the first verifiable entry in Bitcoin‚Äôs ledger. 

Today, January 3, 2026, the system is 17 years old.

‚ÄúChancellor on brink of second bailout for banks.‚Äù
It proved the block was not pre-mined and framed   $BTC as a response to the financial system of that moment.

‚û°Ô∏è After the Genesis Block, the network went silent for 6 days.
Block 1 was mined only on January 9, 2009. 
Many believe this pause was intentional, setting a clean starting rhythm for the system.

‚û°Ô∏è The 50  $BTC reward from the Genesis Block can never be spent.
Because of how the block was hardcoded, those coins are permanently unmovable. 
The address still receives small tribute transactions to this day.

‚û°Ô∏è The Genesis Block was written into the software by hand.
Every other block is produced by the protocol. 
This one exists so the chain has a fixed point of origin.
